title: Help Needed! Small LoL Client Window After Every Game! Bug or no??

embed.description: Image Sem T tulo3 hosted in imgbb.com

body:
Hi, I havent played League for roughly almost 2 months because of university work and when I got back, I've had some problems.

From settings magically changed on my PC, to net problems I had to fix, I have had now this annoying inconvenience with the client. 

Idk how bad my net would be, Im rusty and wanted to practice my CS so I entered the Practice Tool and when I Exited the game I noticed something weird:
After I Exit the Victory screen, the League Client window shows up but it is minuscule! Really, really small, its only a fragent of what it is supposed to be.
Example: Top Right corner
https://ibb.co/dB92dm

And when I Close the Client on the Tool Tab below, it does show the league's "Yes or No" message in the same small window that is suppose to be the scoreboard! (it lets me close that way, at least I have that)
Example:
https://ibb.co/bLCcB6

I experimented entering and exiting the Practice tool many times and the same thing happens and ends with me closing the client to Restart it.
I tried a Bots Game VS AI and the same thing happened and so I couldnt honor anyone on my team and didnt chat with them neither seen the scoreboards.
I still hadnt played Normals and I predict the same would happen. Im happy I can still play but this inconvenience to leave the client after every single game is annoying.

I did a Full Repair and it didnt solve my problem. Maybe Unistall and ReInstall the game might help?
Any help would be appreciated. I fail to see what I am missing here.
Has this happened to any1 before?

LifelessAngel

replies.body:
Ayyyy I'm glad you found an older article which worked for you before I had the time to get back to work! If that doesn't work again for some reason, you could try doing a manual config reset to see if that helps. It could be some kind of resolution confusion going on.

- Log into the game client
- Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\
- Delete the folder named **Config**
- Go into a practice game and verify that settings have saved properly. 
- Leave game to sync settings

I must had done something wrong.
I copy pasted the Config file just in case.
Entered a Practice game, changed my settings there to the ones I wanted.
Left game practice mode and the bug happened yet again.
So I erased the a new Config file that was created automatically and switched to my older one which I saved previously ;_;

It might not be a configuration file related problem if it's not helping, but did you *change* some options or *delete* the folder entirely? If you didn't delete the folder, maybe try again but this time just delete the folder named Config.

If that's not helping, it might just be an issue that you need to keep fixing by using that ctrl +/- suggestion.
